results.title: Mother and son. No. 1 (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), Geoffrey Portmann and Geoffrey Atherden
results.brief_description: The money : Maggie has been saving up her pension cheques and Arthur needs to find them, but where are they? “The aunt” : Arthur invites Maggie’s sister Lorna for a visit. At first all goes well but then Lorna dares to pick some of Maggie’s flowers… “The accident” : Someone drops a typewriter on Arthur’s foot and he’s stuck at home being nursed by Maggie! Stars Ruth Cracknell and Garry McDonald with Henri Szeps and Judy Morris.

results.title: Mother and son. No. 1
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), Geoffrey Atherden and Geoffrey Portmann
results.brief_description: Ruth Cracknell and Gary McDonald are brilliant as Maggie and Arthur. Henri Szeps is Robert, the brother you love to hate, with Judy Morris as his wife, Liz. Maggie appears to be losing her memory, but still knows how to enjoy life. Arthur yearns to be free from the responsibility of caring for Maggie, but he’s stuck, and Maggie makes the most of it. This tape includes three episodes: “The Money” - Maggie has been saving up her pension cheques and hiding them away. “The Aunt” - Arthur invites Maggie’s sister, Lorna, over for a visit. “The Accident” - Arthur injures his foot and Maggie has to look after him.

results.title: Mother and child
results.creator_credit: BBC-TV, Eurfron Gwynne Jones and Francis Fuchs
results.brief_description: Explores the changing relationship between mother and child from birth to school age. Considers two common family crises involving separation - when either mother or child goes to hospital and the arrival of a new baby. Narrated by Hugh David.

results.brief_description: Ruth Cracknell and Gary McDonald are brilliant as Maggie and Arthur. Maggie appears to be losing her memory, but still knows how to enjoy life. Arthur yearns to be free from the responsibility of caring for his mother, but he’s stuck, and Maggie makes the most of it. This tape includes three episodes: The Picnic ; The Last Will and The Cruise.

results.title: Mother's day
results.brief_description: A humorous, satirical and overwhelmingly skilful experimental film by San Francisco poet James Broughton who has discarded the conventions and cliches of film making. Accepting the potentialities of the medium to manipulate both time and space, he brings past and present head-on as he regards with adult feelings his childhood, family and friends. Grown-ups romp like children, and by their magnified infantilism playfully underscore such basic traits as sadism, sensuality and egocentricity. While mother tuns out to be the biggest infant of them all, blindly holding to her ideal of beauty, blind to its disastrous effect upon her entire family. The undertones of this film are disturbing and Broughton has knowingly added to that sense of disturbance by introducing into it a range of objects that appear symbolic. Broughton, however, attempts to expose the audience to a total visual experience, that is poetic and not merely a mystic maze of hidden symbolic meanings. This exploration of an artist’s world of memory, imagination and perception is among the most challenging experimental films produced in America during this period. Photography by Frank Stauffacher.

results.title: Mosquito
results.brief_description: Microphotography is used to reveal the intricate details of the life cycle of the mosquito. Covers the areas of reproduction, anatomy and function as well as disease and pest control.

results.title: Moses Pendleton presents Moses Pendleton
results.creator_credit: ABC Video Enterprises, Fort Worth Productions, Momix, Lucy Hilmer and Robert Elfstrom
results.brief_description: This is a portrait of Moses Pendleton, choreographer and dancer, presenting the artist at home, alone on his 33rd birthday. The film includes excerpts from “Philopolus” and Pendleton’s own “Momix”, and features music by Erik Satie and the Vienna Philharmonic Orchestra.

results.title: Mosaic experiments
results.creator_credit: International Film Bureau, Visual Education Films and Robert Longini
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the techniques, basic elements, and creative aspects of the mosaic medium. Experiments in tesserae, smalti, and Blenke glass which emphasise the richness in variety of materials and forms. Stresses the possibilities of using new and unusual structural elements - bathroom tiles, buttons, pebbles - and points out how commercially available elements can be used in new ways.

results.title: Mosaic
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Norman McLaren and Evelyn Lambart
results.brief_description: A picture of unusual movement, colour and sound, created in a unusual way. It is an example of “op” art in film, a play on the retina of the eye. Basis of the film is a single tiny square that divides, eventually forming a colourful mosaic to the animators musical orchestration. (Awards: New York; Melbourne; Buenos Aires; Vancouver.)
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, Norman McLaren and Evelyn Lambart

results.title: Mosaic
results.creator_credit: AVRB Film Unit, Louise Jonas and Rob McCubbin
results.brief_description: Harold Freedman describes the different processes he undertook in constructing the mosaic at the State Offices, Geelong, Victoria, from the painting of the cartoon to final cleaning and grouting. The completed mosaic is shown in detail at the end of the film.
